That's a fantastic approach! Creating a podcast playlist and sharing your own experiences can be a great way to introduce others to the world of podcasting. By leading by example and showcasing the benefits of podcasts, you can inspire others to give it a try.

Remember to tailor your playlist to your friends' and family members' interests, so they can see the value and relevance of podcasts to their own lives. You might also consider including a brief description or review of each podcast to help them understand what they're about.

When sharing your own experiences, be sure to highlight the aspects of podcasts that you enjoy the most, such as:

* How podcasts have helped you learn new things or expand your knowledge
* How they've provided entertainment or relaxation during commutes or downtime
* How they've introduced you to new perspectives or ways of thinking
* How they've helped you stay informed about current events or topics you care about

By sharing your genuine enthusiasm and passion for podcasts, you can help spark interest and curiosity in others.

And, of course, discussing episodes with them can be a great way to build a sense of community and shared experience. You might even discover new insights or perspectives through these conversations!

Remember to be patient and encouraging, and don't be afraid to offer guidance or recommendations as they start their podcasting journey. Good luck, and I hope you have fun sharing your love of podcasts with your friends and family!
